meanings.definition: A sulfur-containing amino acid that is a structural component of many proteins.
meanings.sent1: The body needs cystine to build strong proteins.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how cystine contributes to protein structures.
meanings.sent3: When the chef added extra cystine to the recipe, the dish turned into a protein-packed surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as unbreakable as a bond of cystine.
meanings.sent5: In the laboratory, the students marveled at the intricate structure of cystine under the microscope.

meanings.definition: A crystalline amino acid formed from two cysteine molecules linked by a disulfide bond.
meanings.sent1: The crystal clear cystine sparkled under the light.
meanings.sent2: The disulfide bond in cystine gives it a unique structure.
meanings.sent3: The jewelry designer crafted a necklace inspired by the shape of cystine crystals.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was as strong as the bond in cystine.
meanings.sent5: The scientist observed the formation of cystine crystals in the experiment.
